explanation: The test pyramid recommends many fast unit tests at the bottom, fewer integration tests in the middle, and even fewer E2E tests at the top. This balances speed, reliability, and coverage.
sampleAnswers: The test pyramid recommends many fast unit tests at the bottom, fewer integration tests in the middle, and even fewer E2E tests at the top. This balances speed, reliability, and coverage.

title: How do you test React components effectively?
content: Describe practices and tools for testing React components (rendering, interactions, state, async behavior, accessibility).
explanation: Use React Testing Library + Jest to test rendered output and user interactions, mock network calls, test accessibility using axe, avoid implementation-detail assertions, and use snapshots sparingly.

title: Which tools are commonly used for E2E testing in modern frontend apps?
content: Select the commonly used E2E testing tools and one key advantage of each (Cypress, Playwright, Selenium).
explanation: Cypress and Playwright are popular for modern apps; Selenium is older and broad but more complex.

options.text: Cypress: developer-friendly, great debugging UX
Playwright: cross-browser automation and parallelism
Selenium: mature but heavier and more complex to manage
None of the above are used for E2E

title: What causes flaky tests and how do you fix them?
content: Explain common causes of flaky tests (timing, network, order dependency) and strategies to make tests reliable.
explanation: Flakiness can be caused by race conditions, unstable selectors, reliance on real network, or shared state. Fix by using stable selectors, mock network calls, add deterministic waits or better synchronization, isolate tests, and reset environment between runs.

title: Which checks should run locally vs in CI?
content: Decide which tasks are suitable for local developer runs and which should be enforced in CI (lint, unit tests, integration, E2E, build).
explanation: Developers should run fast checks locally; heavier/integration/E2E tests and release builds should run in CI.

options.text: Run lint and unit tests locally before PR
Run full E2E suite in CI (not required for every local dev run)
Skip build step in CI
Run heavy integration tests only in CI pipelines

title: How do you design a CI pipeline for a frontend app?
content: Outline a typical CI pipeline stages for frontend: install, lint, unit tests, build, integration/E2E, artifact publish, and deploy.
explanation: Typical pipeline: checkout -> install deps -> lint -> unit tests -> build -> static analysis/security scan -> run integration/E2E in parallel -> publish artifacts -> deploy to staging -> run smoke tests -> promote to production with deployment strategy (canary/blue-green).

title: How can you speed up test suites in CI?
content: Discuss techniques such as test parallelization, caching node_modules, test sharding, and running only affected tests.
explanation: Speedups: enable CI caching for dependencies, run tests in parallel across workers, shard E2E tests by test suites, run only affected tests using changed-file detection, and use lightweight mocked E2E for quick smoke.
sampleAnswers: Speedups: enable CI caching for dependencies, run tests in parallel across workers, shard E2E tests by test suites, run only affected tests using changed-file detection, and use lightweight mocked E2E for quick smoke.

title: What is visual regression testing and when should you use it?
content: Explain visual regression testing and tools for it (Percy, Chromatic, Playwright snapshot).
explanation: Visual regression testing captures UI screenshots and compares diffs to detect unintended UI changes. Use for design-critical components, theming changes, or when CSS changes might break layouts.

title: How do you enforce quality gates in CI and integrate them with code review?
content: Describe quality gates like test coverage thresholds, linting, security scans, and how to integrate results into pull requests and CI protections.
explanation: Quality gates ensure that only PRs meeting minimum quality metrics are merged; surface results in PRs for reviewer context.

options.text: Fail CI build on critical lint or test failures
Block merge unless coverage meets threshold (e.g., >80%)
Ignore E2E failures permanently
Publish test reports and comments on PR for visibility
